name: Greg Conner
title: Greg Conner
bio:
I have been in the media business for 28 years, 4 years in newspaper and 24 in Broadcast TV. 

During those 28 years, I have worked in Asheville, NC, Las Vegas, NV, Greensboro, NC, Columbia, SC, Albany, GA, Macon, GA and Augusta, GA.

While in broadcast TV, I have held the positions of Local Account Executive, National Account Executive, Local Sales Manager, Director of Sales and General Manager.

My philosophy has always been: be transparent, build trust, and be a partner, not just a sales person. Nothing makes me happier than helping my clients (partners) achieve their goals.

Even as a General Manager, I love going to visit clients and educating them in the ways Gray Marketing Augusta can help them grow their business and achieve their goals.

name: Jennifer Dixon
title: Jennifer Dixon
bio:
I like to say I wear a lot of hats, and luckily, I love me a cute hat. I’m a dedicated teammate, and self-declared broadcast veteran, bringing over 20 years of sales experience with News 12 26. Raised right here in the CSRA, I’ve built my career on relationships with my incredible team, our loyal clients, and this amazing community I love calling home.

For the past 14 and half years, I’ve been the Executive Producer of our call-in show LawCall on WRDW, which basically means on Sunday nights, I help the Lawyers give legal insight to viewers that makes sense. Outside of sales and legal talk, I’ve been a proud advocate for the American Heart Association for over a decade. I use my Southern charm to help raise awareness and rally support, and it’s one of the most rewarding hats I wear. Whether I’m brainstorming campaign ideas with the sales team, cheering on a client’s success, or just making sure everyone has enough caffeine to survive a Monday, I try to bring heart, hustle, and humor to everything I do.

At home, I’m a wife and proud mom of three, which means I occasionally feel like a referee, short-order cook, motivational speaker, and unpaid Uber driver... all before 8 a.m. Have I mastered the whole work-life balance thing? Not even close. But I show up every day with a full to-do list, a big smile, and the hope that I remembered to bring a pair of heels, instead of my house shoes.

My goal is simple: keep learning, keep growing, and keep helping my team and our clients win, one idea, one laugh, and one (very large) cup of coffee/snack at a time.

name: Laethon Bumgardner
title: Media Executive
bio:
Being a born and raised Augustan native, I have learned more and more about how our community is built. I am now taking reins at being hands-on to build up this community one connection at a time. I excel at understanding metrics regarding social media and search engine optimizing, as I was previously a local coffee chain’s Digital Marketing Manager- I can make a great cup of joe too!

Following suit in my Bachelor’s in Film and Digital Media, I have essentially been studying for my role of being a Media Executive for WRDW and WAGT. Here, we serve the community not only in sharing the latest news- We bring the community together by helping people and businesses connect through our advertising during broadcasts, on our website, and across social media. I started my journey with the station as an editor for our nightly news shows, giving me leverage with firsthand experience on the newsroom floor to curate the best products for you.

I aim to use my work and life experience, and your expertise in your field, to yield the perfect strategy for making local businesses thrive!

name: Emerald Francis
title: Emerald Francis
bio: I’m happily married and share my home with my beloved fur babies. I bring over 17 years of experience in the broadcast industry. A true expert in all things TV commercial-related, I have a deep understanding of the industry and a passion for delivering results that resonate on screen. Outside of work, I’m dedicated to inspiring others to prioritize wellness in their everyday lives.

name: Julie Morgan
title: Julie Morgan
bio: With over 12 years' experience in B2B outside sales, 4 years in both web development and project management, and 2 years in digital marketing, I bring a dynamic blend of experience to the table. I specialize in leading digital campaigns from initial concept through successful launch, ensuring every detail is optimized for performance. My approach combines strategic insight, technical know-how, and hands-on execution to deliver measurable results. I value clear, timely communication, efficient workflows, and getting things done expeditiously. Let’s bring your next digital campaign to life - I’m excited to collaborate!

name: Brenda Ramsey
title: Brenda Ramsey
bio: With over 20 years in broadcast advertising, I have seen it all—from reel-to-reel to real-time digital. I am a loyal, hardworking pro with a knack for turning chaos into campaigns and deadlines into done deals. Funny, Godly, and fiercely dedicated, I try to bring heart and humor to everything I do. I am always up for a challenge, continue to learn, especially as the digital world changes faster than my grandkids' tastes in cartoons. I am a proud mother of two and Nana to two, I have mastered the art of multitasking—juggling meetings, Zoom calls, and lunchtime with my work besties. If you're looking for someone who knows her stuff, keeps it real, and can make you laugh while getting the job done, I am your partner.

name: Susan Deluca
title: Susan Deluca
bio:
I may be a Pennsylvania native, but I’m a true Southerner at heart. With more than 9 years in sales at the station, I’m known for my hard work, sharp focus, and quick wit. Whether I’m helping a client build a campaign or jumping in to support a teammate, I’m always ready to roll up my sleeves and get business handled—efficiently and with a smile.

I’m a proud mom of two and a loving Ya Ya to a lucky few, and I balance my professional drive with a deep love for family, animals, and my favorite pastime—tuning into QVC. My warmth, dedication, and no-nonsense approach make me an invaluable part of the team and a trusted partner to every client I work with.

name: Chris Claypool
title: Chris Claypool
bio:
As a business growth expert in Broadcast & Digital Marketing for over 30 years, I’m passionate about crafting data-driven strategies that deliver measurable results. I have a proven track record of success helping local companies grow their business. And as a graduate of the University of Georgia with a degree in Advertising, I believe in building strong relationships with my clients and working collaboratively to achieve their goals. Let's talk about how I can help your business thrive.

Life Quote: “Be the Bacon”

name: Chip Creamer
title: Chip Creamer
bio: I am a lifelong resident of the CSRA and I have been watching WRDW/WAGT since I was a child growing up in Jackson, SC. I have been working in local television for more than 30 years. I have an extensive background in most aspects of TV including production, creative services, reporting and sales. I write my own scripts and many times do my own voiceovers for commercials. My personal sales philosophy is simple, I treat all clients and potential clients the way I would want to be treated. I listen to my clients’ marketing needs and provide a solution that will help them reach projected goals. There is nothing better than to help a client’s business grow and build long term relationships. One important rule I follow: never promise what you can’t deliver. With technology constantly changing, I am certified by Gray Media, our parent company, to also provide digital marketing solutions for clients in addition to a television schedule. Feel free to contact me and let me help you.

name: Chandler Johnson
title: Chandler Johnson
bio: Born and raised in the CSRA, I bring a fresh and energetic perspective to the world of sales, with just over a year of experience under my belt. I’m passionate about making business owners’ lives easier by being a true advocate for their advertising needs. With a strong work ethic and a natural niche for all things sports-related, I’m driven, hardworking, and committed to helping my clients succeed through smart, effective solutions.

name: Alexis Musick
title: Alexis Musick
bio:
I’m passionate about helping local businesses grow through strategic storytelling and creative marketing campaigns. With a background in advertising, graphic design, and digital strategy, I bring a unique mix of creativity and business savvy to every project.

I partner closely with each client to understand their goals and develop custom campaigns that deliver results—whether through streaming TV, targeted digital ads, or live interviews on The Morning Mix. I believe every business has a powerful story worth sharing, and I’m dedicated to making sure it reaches the right audience.

When I’m not helping clients shine, you’ll find me spending time with my husband and two kids, practicing martial arts, or volunteering through my church. I’m proud to be part of a team that puts community first and I love helping local brands make a lasting impact.

name: Peggy Maddox
title: Peggy Maddox
bio:
I’m a Marketing Executive for Gray Media. With over 40 years of experience, I’m dedicated to creating impactful partnerships and campaigns that help businesses grow.

I graduated from Augusta University, on the dean's list, with a marketing degree and initially worked in the advertising agency world where I learned many useful skills. 23 years ago, I got a position at WAGT Television in sales, navigated a few ownership transitions and today I work for Gray Media. I’m passionate about the power of television to connect advertisers and customers. And even though the landscape changes exponentially quickly these days with so many more options and possibilities, I still believe in innovation and most importantly, collaboration, to achieve common goals.

name: Zaria Scott
title: Zaria Scott
bio: I’m a proud native of the CSRA area, and I combine my deep understanding of the local market with a robust background in business and entrepreneurship to develop integrated advertising campaigns across broadcast and digital platforms. My approach is professional, results-driven, and centered on clear communication and authentic storytelling. I’m committed to building partnerships that deliver measurable impact and resonate with the community I serve.

name: Marc Williamson
title: Marc Williamson
bio: With over 19 years in media, I started at WAGT and grew into roles at both WAGT and WRDW. Today, we’re more than broadcast—we’re a full-service digital agency offering streaming, targeted digital ads, and even digital billboards. I’m not a high-pressure sales rep. I’m a media consultant and true partner, focused on helping your business grow. My goal? For you to look forward to every conversation, knowing I’m bringing fresh ideas that drive results. Born and raised in Augusta, I’ve been married 32 years, with four kids and two grandkids. I love this community—and helping local businesses succeed is what I do best. Let’s talk about how we can take your business to the next level!

name: Kameron Robinson
title: Kameron Robinson
bio:
I’ve been in the news industry for 11 years across three states. I began my career just before graduating from the University of St. Francis, where I majored in animation with a minor in communication. My first 5 years in news were spent working in the news production department. I started as a floor director and, over the years, worked my way up to Assistant Newscast Director, Newscast Director, and ultimately Senior Newscast Director.

Even though directing was something I excelled at, I didn’t have a passion for it and still felt drawn to video work. So I decided to step away from the news department for a chance to work in Creative Services, and I haven’t looked back since. After spending 3 years as a Creative Services Producer in Fort Wayne, IN, where my career began, I had the opportunity to take a job in Cleveland, OH, where I was able to sharpen my skills. 3 years in Cleveland taught me so much, and with that knowledge, I decided to take the next step and was accepted into Gray Media’s corporate marketing leadership program.

After spending a year learning different aspects of the job, I was happy to accept my first Creative Services Director position here in Augusta. I look forward to using everything I’ve learned in my career to make the most out of every commercial and promo. And most importantly, to collaborate with clients to help their business succeed with creativity and a smile.

name: Kurt Smith
title: Kurt Smith
bio:
Born in Germany around the time of the country’s reunification, I spent the majority of my childhood years moving back-and-forth between Europe and the United States with my military family. It was during these years that I developed a passion for all things related to film and animation, as well as my solid work ethic and the ability to operate as part of a collective effort. Germany is also where I graduated from high school and earned an associates degree, shortly before returning to the USA one final time to land in the state of Georgia. There I enrolled at SCAD in Savannah to pursue a degree in traditional animation, and after which landed my first job in the industry in the city of Atlanta. My crew and I worked together to produce an animated series for the FX network, but I decided to return home to Augusta following the wrapping up of production on the first season, where I have since joined the staff at WRDW News 12-26.

As a member of its Creative Services department, I am responsible for filming live-action footage, recording voice-over audio, and editing said assets into commercials and event promos for our station’s sponsors and Sales clients. I also participate in the various non-profit events that are organized by ourselves or other organizations, and I will occasionally offer my expertise to the News team when they require either a camera operator or branding for a new program. During my time in Creative Services, I have learned new and exciting ways to provide engaging marketing material for our clients, as well as collaborating with my supremely talented colleagues to create astounding works and complete our projects well ahead of their deadlines. Garnering a reputation for high quality at a rapid pace and for maintaining composure in high-pressure situations, I eagerly look forward to new challenges in the future as an opportunity for expanding both my knowledge and my growing repertoire of skills.

name: Clayton Richardson
title: Clayton Richardson
bio:
Hi!

My name's Clayton. I was born and raised in the CSRA and got my Communication degree at Augusta University. I've been an amateur filmmaker for almost a decade. I love coming up with out of the box ideas and then figuring out how to make those ideas a reality. Video production may be my expertise but I also enjoy drawing, painting, and a little photography here and there. If you want to talk comics, manga, video games, or new advances in technology, you'll have my ear for hours.

Oh and cryptids, #BIGFOOTISREAL.

name: Jae Florence Corales
title: Jae Florence Corales
bio:
As a multidisciplinary creative with over 10 years of experience in graphic design, photography, and art, I bring bold ideas to life across digital, print, and broadcast platforms. I’m originally from the Philippines and now based in Augusta, Georgia where I continue to blend design with purpose and impact.

I earned my BA in Graphic Design with a minor in Computer Science from Western Illinois University in 2025 and previously studied visual arts at Black Hawk College. My creative journey includes roles as a lead designer for universities, freelance projects under PNTLSTA Creative, and collaborative work within fast-paced media teams. Whether I’m building a brand, producing content, or crafting a campaign, I’m driven by clarity, emotion, and strong visual storytelling.
